title: Latina railway station
text:
Latina is the main <a href="railway%20station">railway station</a> of the Italian city of <a href="Latina%2C%20Lazio">Latina</a>, in the region of <a href="Lazio">Lazio</a>. It is owned by the "<a href="Ferrovie%20dello%20Stato">Ferrovie dello Stato</a>", the national rail company of <a href="Italy">Italy</a>, and is an important train station of its region.
Geography.
The station is located in <a href="Latina%20Scalo">Latina Scalo</a>, a suburb in the northern part of <a href="Latina%2C%20Lazio">Latina</a>. It is the most distant station from the city centre of an Italian seat of province: due to this, 9 km, local and regional authorities have presented several projects to build a rail, or a <a href="light%20rail">light rail</a>, from it to an eventual "Latina Città" (i.e. "Latina City") station.
History.
The station was inaugurated on July 17, 1922, at the opening of the new direct line from <a href="Roma%20Termini%20railway%20station">Rome</a> to <a href="Napoli%20Centrale%20railway%20station">Naples</a>, via <a href="Formia%20railway%20station">Formia</a>. In the early years of service, when the city of Latina didn't exist, it was a simple train stop serving some little villages close to the <a href="swamp">swamp</a>s composing the environment of the <a href="Pontine%20Marshes">Pontine Marshes</a>. In 1932, during <a href="Italian%20fascism">fascism</a> and after the foundation of the actual city, the new station of Littoria (original name of Latina, named after the "<a href="Fasces">fascio littorio</a>") was enlarged and a new <a href="Station%20building">building</a> projected by the architect <a href="Angiolo%20Mazzoni">Angiolo Mazzoni</a>. During this period some diesel <a href="multiple%20unit">multiple unit</a> (<a href="Diesel%20multiple%20unit">DMU</a>) trains were inaugurated in a regional <a href="Rome">Rome</a> to <a href="Littoria">Littoria</a> service, colloquially named "Littorine" (plural) and "Littorina" (singular) after the city. In Italy this colloquial name survives; it is generally used to identify the DMU trains. After the renaming of the city in 1946 also the station took the actual name.

Structure and transport.
Latina station counts a large one-floor <a href="Station%20building">building</a>, located close to the freight shed. It counts 4 <a href="Track%20%28rail%20transport%29">tracks</a> for passenger service and 5 terminal tracks, in the northern side, for <a href="goods%20wagon">goods wagon</a>s.
The station is electrified and served by regional trains (mainly to <a href="Rome">Rome</a>, <a href="Naples">Naples</a>, <a href="Formia">Formia</a>, and <a href="Terracina">Terracina</a>) and also by the suburban Roman line <a href="FR7%20%28Lazio%20regional%20railways%29">FR7</a> part of the <a href="Ferrovie%20regionali%20del%20Lazio">Lazio regional railways</a>. Latina has no direct links to some other city stations of its region (as <a href="Frosinone">Frosinone</a>, <a href="Viterbo">Viterbo</a>, <a href="Rieti">Rieti</a> or <a href="Cassino">Cassino</a>) and is linked to <a href="Civitavecchia">Civitavecchia</a> only with InterCity services.
Located onto one of the principal <a href="Italy">Italian</a> rail lines, the <a href="Rome%E2%80%93Formia%E2%80%93Naples%20railway">Rome-Latina-Formia-Naples</a>, it is served for long distance transport by several <a href="InterCity">InterCity</a> and <a href="Express%20train">Express</a> trains to Rome, <a href="Turin">Turin</a>, <a href="Milan">Milan</a>, Naples, <a href="Venice">Venice</a>, <a href="Palermo">Palermo</a>, <a href="Syracuse%2C%20Sicily">Syracuse</a>, <a href="Reggio%20Calabria">Reggio Calabria</a> and <a href="Bolzano">Bolzano</a>, linking it also with <a href="Genoa">Genoa</a>, <a href="Bologna">Bologna</a>, <a href="Florence">Florence</a>, <a href="Pisa">Pisa</a>, <a href="Verona">Verona</a>, <a href="Catania">Catania</a>, <a href="Messina">Messina</a> and other cities. Periodically is served by a <a href="EuroCity">EuroCity</a> from Naples to <a href="Munich">Munich</a> but, as it happens for <a href="Formia%20railway%20station">Formia</a> and <a href="Aversa%20railway%20station">Aversa</a>, it is not served by any <a href="Eurostar%20Italia">EuroStar</a> <a href="High-speed%20rail">high-speed train</a>.
